reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a 3 night stay in the Ana Mandara in Hue as part of our recent trip to SE Asia. The minute we drove through the gates we felt like we were in a cocoon of comfort, the staff were extremely helpfull and took care of everything you could ask for.
reviews.title: Ultimate Luxury in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room, a Deluxe Double, was immense and luxurious, and a mere 20 meters or so from the pool and the beach. The bed was enormous and super soft and comfy, and the food in the restaurants was sublime. The first night we asked if we could eat on the roof terrace, and everyone went out of their way to facilitate this, bringing pillows for the seats, candles for light, and even the manager came out to take our orders. We enjoyed some amazing Vietnamese inspired food, just the two of us, lit by candles and the stars above.
reviews.title: A perfect break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The next day we enjoyed the superb pool, and the private beach, and had dinner in our room, and the last day we ate in one of the restaurants, on the ground floor terrace. Each time the food was absolutely sublime.
reviews.title: Lovely beachside resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: You can also choose from a range of dining experiences, which include the option to enjoy a private BBQ on the beach, or an "Imperial Dinner" in your room, if you fancy. And they can arrange tours, or you can use the complimentary bicycles provided if that's more to your liking.
reviews.title: Paradise found!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we though it was an absolute bargain, and the only problem we had was this it was fully booked for the weekend, so we couldn't stay any longer..
reviews.title: A Great stay at Ana Mandara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I just spent my national holiday and labor holiday at Ana Mandara Hue resort, it is a nice resort with comfortable villa, not as other resort on the beach that just caring for services and pool, beach...this resort almost arrange fully equipments on each room, big shower room with both bathtub and standing shower, we are lucky to choose this resort for this holiday with many children and quite naughty, we have privacy and not affect other people stay there, it is easy to access swimming pool and beach, even though the beach is not very clear, and with a bit big waves, sea food nearby restaurant is fresh and reasonable, we want to come back this resort in future
reviews.title: just had 2 nights at this resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't think most would think of Hue when considering a Vietnam beach vacation. However, the beaches are every bit as nice, and more secluded, and than those in Da Nang, Hoi An etc... The only problem is the weather is not always as nice in Hue.
reviews.title: Great Beach Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: My wife and I spent nearly a week here at the Ana Mandara and found it incredibly relaxing. The grounds are amazing and the rooms top notch. There is almost no reason you would need to leave the resort - which is good because it is about a 20min drive into the city centre. This makes it the perfect place to stay for someone looking to get away and relax, though probably not the best place to see the sites of Hue from.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The not so good: the food is a little pricey and there aren't many other options around the hotel. The staff are friendly but at times the place is a little understaffed so you may find yourself waiting to be helped.
reviews.title: amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tips: BOOK THE BEACH SIDE VILLA. It is worth the little bit of extra money and so much better than the standard rooms. The beach side villas are probably one of the most luxurious rooms I've ever stayed in and at a very affordable price.
reviews.title: Best kept secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ana Mandara resort is of a high standard and we spent an enjoyable six night stay in March 2013. There were a few highlights but equally some drawbacks. During our stay we made use of the the 241 offer in the spa and had a Vietnamese massage and facial. I was surprised that the therapist was a man but that didn't prevent the treatments being relaxing and enjoyable. The only downside was the quality of the products, which didn't seem particularly luxurious. Not sure that the pool area of the spa is used at all as we didn't see anyone use it and despite arriving for the spa treatment early wasn't given the opportunity to use it.
reviews.title: High standard but some minor niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: We stayed in a ground floor pool room which was very well equipped and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Currently a guest.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food quality wasn't great and was the main drawback. Breakfast offers a good choice for all cultural tastes (cold French fries as a cereal option is bizarre in any country). Lunch options were good as was the quality. The dinner menu is limited and we found items unavailable on each dining occasion. The beef filet dish wasn't good, it took a lot of sawing and chewing to be filet!
reviews.title: Has to be the best hotel/resort in Vietnam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned by other reviewers the promised wifi was very spotty and this was frustrating.
reviews.title: a great end to a woderful holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We weren't made aware of who the managers were but I suspect they weren't around during the weekend because there was a noticeable step up in service from the Monday. Staff were helpful but more reactive than proactive, a little extra coaching will easily rectify this. Final point is that pool bar is so exposed to the elements it would be beneficial to create an extra social gathering point for the evening, lots of space in the hotel seemed under-used.
reviews.title: Great Resort pity about the typhoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach villa we upgraded to was sheer bliss. the sound of the waves, overlooking a delightful long sandy beach and the facilities within were pretty near perfect. Magnificent hugely massive bed, crisp linen two large terraces one with loungers the other with comfy seats. A big pool, good food, nice company - almost perfection. The early evenings were best, as the various fishing boats drifted across from left to right setting out for a nights work. To the left they were all berthed on the sands and to the right was the local village much of it on the beach offering alternative eating options.
reviews.title: Almost a five but a few things could yet improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff were delightful, at times overly so, but who could complain at that?
reviews.title: wonderuful stay in April 2013
First impression/quick review
reviews.text: So close to idyllic, but some silly negatives also, plus one big one - we were quite a way from Hue and unlike the Victoria Resort in Hoi An, which bears comparison, one had to plan any trips to and from the town. It could take from 30 -45 minutes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The silliest negative is that the pool was always very warm and one almost got out of the pool to cool down. The other no no and this one greatly irritated everyone there, was that they closed the lovely pool bar at seven after happy hour. A big error, as we all wanted somewhere cool and breezy to drink at after our evening meal. Everyone was in bed by 9.30 pm maybe even earlier. The bar that was open remained empty and was not attractive. This more than anything needs attention.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay; right on the beach yet not far from the town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had spent almost three weeks hard slog around China, so were really content to just slob out for a week and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Very restful.
reviews.title: Dishonest staff
Relaxing in paradise best resort I have stayed at.
reviews.text: After Hanoi it was great to come here and unwind. The staff were fabulous. The pool beautiful. However it was still quite cold here at this time of year. The resturant had lovely food. Stayed in beach villa which had a lovely outdoor shower and views of ocean. Softest beds sleeping listening to the ocean. The ocean was very rough at this tome of year. Summer is meant to be better for weather and ocean. Were sad to leave.

reviews.title: Ana Mandara Hue
reviews.text: Anybody interested in travelling the coastline of Vietnam should allow time to visit the

reviews.title: Amazing Space - great staff
reviews.text: Ana Mandara Resort. We were informally introduced to this outstanding Resort through

reviews.title: Simply put WOW
reviews.text: a group of Australians we meet in Moi Chi Min city. Fabulously located on a stunning

reviews.title: Best hotel room that I've ever stayed in.
reviews.text: streach of the sandy Vietnamese coast this luxurious development boasts absolute beach front and garden villas with superbly appointed open plan rooms, communal and private pools, stunning dining and entertainment facilities and the friendliest staff and management we have very encountered anywhere in the world. Personal rating 9/10.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thankyou for your help and advice when iwas dealing with vietnam airways it was very much appreciated We made all our transfers home..My wife and I very much enjoyed our stay at your delightful hotel it has been one of our most relaxing and enjoyable holidays for many a year
reviews.title: aussie tony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: thanks to every one who works at the mandara nothing was to much trouble. the only negative we had is we should have stayed longer than the 8 days we had
reviews.title: Great get away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My partner and I have just got back from a three night get away in this loverly beach resort hotel. The weather was not great so we spent a lot of time in the exceptionally comfortable bed which was huge and just loverly. We asked if there was a room with an actual sea view, as the first one we more a sea sound then view, and we were moved within five minute.
reviews.title: a magical resort for a magical holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Great staff and with some well thought out touches. If I had to be picky... Which is hard... The Eco bath room refill pumps are clearly not designed for such think gels and they splurged out the seal. Electric in our room were in need of some attention, but was just to busy relaxing to remember to inform the hotel. So 156 need a little check...
reviews.title: Great villa, good food, can do attitude. Just be careful when booking the beach villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and I am a fan of 80's music to yazz 'the only way is up' at breakfast was... An interesting choice! Pool great, beach great, gym great, front desk area very pretty, definitely would go again for sure.
reviews.title: Just right for R&R
